User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user in the GiftExchangeHub application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

type.description: The type of user (e.g., Blue, Pink).

roleLevel.description: Indicates the level of access of the user (role).

Gift.title: Gift
Gift.description: Represents a gift in the catalog.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Gift entity.

name.description: The localized names of the gift.

collection.description: The collection the gift belongs to.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Collection entity.

name.description: The localized names of the collection.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Rarity entity.

name.description: The localized names of the rarity.

color.description: The color associated with the rarity.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Transaction entity.

fromUserId.description: The ID of the user giving/sending the gift.

toUserId.description: The ID of the user receiving the gift.

participants.description: An array containing the IDs of both users, for security rule queries.

giftId.description: The ID of the gift being exchanged.

deliveryStatus.description: The delivery status of the gift (e.g., Pending, Delivered, Canceled).

settlementStatus.description: The settlement status of the transaction (e.g., Unpaid, Paid, Canceled).

date.description: The date and time of the transaction.

type.description: The type of transaction (e.g., exchange, gift, send).

id.description: Unique identifier for the Exchange entity.

fromId.description: The ID of the transaction for the user giving/sending the gift.

toId.description: The ID of the transaction for the user receiving the gift.

participants.description: An array containing the IDs of the users from the transactions corresponding to this exchange, for security rule queries.

giftId.description: The ID of the gift being exchanged.

date.description: The date and time of the transaction.

type.description: The type of transaction (e.g., gift, send).

status.description: The status of the exchange (e.g., pending, complete).

WishlistItem.title: WishlistItem
WishlistItem.description: Represents an item in a user's wishlist. This is a client-side entity, stored in localStorage.

userId.description: The ID of the user who owns the wishlist.

giftIds.description: An array of gift IDs in the user's wishlist.

customClaims.name: roleLevel
customClaims.description: Provides the level of access of the user. This claim is set and managed by a secure API endpoint and is used in Firestore security rules to grant access to restricted resources.

definition.description: Stores user profiles. User data is private and accessed via path-based ownership or by admins.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user.

definition.description: Stores the gift catalog. Gifts can be listed by any user, but only modified by admins.

params.name: collectionId

params.name: rarityId
params.description: The unique identifier of the rarity.

params.name: exchangeId

params.name: transactionId
params.description: The unique identifier of the transaction.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to optimize for security, scalability, and ease of debugging. I've moved transactions to a root collection to simplify administrative queries and will rely on array-contains checks for user-specific access, a common and scalable pattern.

methods.description: Authenticates a user and returns a custom Firebase token.
Creates a new user, updates their custom claims, and stores their data in Firestore. This endpoint is protected and can only be accessed by administrators (roleLevel 2).

403.description: Forbidden. The requesting user is not an administrator.

methods.description: Retrieves an existing user, their custom claims, and their data in Firestore. This endpoint is available to all users.

params.description: The unique identifier of the user to read.

methods.description: Updates an existing user, their custom claims, and their data in Firestore. This endpoint is protected and can only be accessed by administrators (roleLevel 2).
